sen.j: 明法博士（みょうほうはかせ）は、古代日本の律令制下において大学寮に属した官職の一つ。
sen.e: Myoho hakase was one of official posts under the ancient Japanese Ritsuryo system that belonged to Daigakuryo (Bureau of Education).
Myoho hakase was an officlal post affiliated with the Daigakuryo (Bureau of Education) under the ancient Japanese ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: added information on the ritsuryo system in parenthesis to follow the word list; changed sentence order for clarity
sen.e: Myoho hakase was an official post affiliated with the Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education) under the ancient Japanese ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: スペルなどを変えました。

sen.e: This post was ryogekan (a post outside of the Ritsuryo system).
The post itself was ryoge no kan (a post outside of the ritsuryo system).
sen.cmt: Fixed grammar for clarity
sen.e: The post itself was Ryoge no kan (a post outside of the ritsuryo system).
sen.cmt: 表記を変えました。

sen.j: 定員2名で、当初は正七位下相当。
sen.e: Its prescribed number of personnel was two persons and persons whose court rank was Shoshichiinoge (Senior seventh Rank, Lower Grade) were appointed initially.
At any one time, there could be only two Myoho hakase and the position was initially appointed to court officials with a rank of Shoshichiinoge (Senior seventh Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: Fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: At any one time, there could be only two Myoho hakase and the position was initially appointed to court officials with a rank of Shoshichiinoge (Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 表記を変えました。

sen.j: 後に名門出身者で占められるようになった。
sen.e: Later, persons came from distinguished families monopolized this post.
The post was later monopolized by people from distinguished families.
sen.cmt: Fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The post was later monopolized by people from distinguished families.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 神亀5年7月21日 (旧暦)（728年8月30日）の格式において文章博士とともに設置された。
sen.e: This post was created by kyakushiki (amendment of the Ritsuryo code) dated August 30, 728 along with Monjo hakase (Professor of Literature).
In a kyakushiki (amendment of the ritsuryo code) during the Jinki era dated August 30, 728, Myoho hakase was instituted at the same time as Monjo hakase (Professor of Literature).
sen.cmt: Add "Jinki" to coincide with the Japanese 神亀 since there is a wiki article on the era;
sen.e: In a kyakushiki (amendment of the ritsuryo code) on September 3, 728, Myoho hakase was instituted at the same time as Monjo hakase (Professor of Literature).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直しました。

sen.j: 当初の名称は律学博士（りつがくはかせ）であったが、天平2年3月27日 (旧暦)（730年4月18日）に明法生が設置されてから遠くない時期に明法博士と改称されたとされている。
sen.e: Its original name was Ritsugaku hakase (Professor of Law), but the name was changed to Myoho hakase before too long after Myohosho (students studying the law) was created on April 18, 730.
The post was originally called Ritsugaku hakase (Professor of Law) but the name was changed shortly after the Myohosho (students studying law) was established on April 18, 730.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The post was originally called Ritsugaku hakase (Professor of Law) but the name was changed shortly after the Myohosho (students studying law) was established on April 22, 730.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直しました。

sen.j: 大学において法律（明法道）を教授する役職で、律令法や格式の編纂や解釈にも携わった。
sen.e: Its duty was to teach the law (Myobodo (study of Codes)) at daigaku (university) as well as to compile and interpret the Ritsuryo code and kyakushiki.
Its official position was to teach the law (Myobodo (the study of codes)) at a university in addition to compiling and interpreting the ritsuryo code and kyakushiki.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Its official position was to teach the law (Myobodo (the study of codes)) at a university in addition to compiling and interpreting the ritsuryo code and kyakushiki.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 明法博士の下には明法得業生（みょうほうとくぎょうしょう）2名と明法生（みょうほうしょう）10名（後に20名）があった。
sen.e: Two persons of Myoho Tokugyosho (distinguished scholars of law) and ten persons of Myohosho (later 20 persons) were placed under Myoho hakase.
Two Myoho Tokugyosho (distinguished scholars) and ten Myohosho (later becoming twenty) were placed as pupils under a Myoho hakase.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: 2 Myoho Tokugyosho (distinguished scholars) and 10 Myohosho (later becoming 20) were placed as pupils under a Myoho hakase.
sen.cmt: 表記を合わせてアラビア数字にしました。

sen.j: 後には、陣定などの朝議に際して法律的な見解を記した明法勘文を作成・提出することも重要な職務となった。
sen.e: Later, drafting Myoho kanmon, an opinion concerning legal matters, and submitting it to chogi (a court council) such as jin no sadame (ancient cabinet council) also became its important duty.

Later on they were given the important duty of drawing up a Myobo kanmon, which expressed their opinions concerning legal matters, and submitting it to a court council such as the Jin no sadame (ancient cabinet council).
sen.cmt: eliminated "chogi" since there is no wikipedia article link for it and the direct translation makes it easier to read; fixed the error of "Myoho" to "Myobo"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Later on they were given the important duty of drawing up a Myobo kanmon, which expressed their opinions concerning legal matters, and submitting it to a court council such as the Jin no sadame (ancient cabinet council).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 平安時代中期には讃岐氏や惟宗氏の世襲の傾向が見られたが、中世以降には両氏に代わって、名望の坂上氏及び中原氏の世襲となった。
sen.e: This post gradually became the hereditary post of the Sanuki clan and the Koremune clan in the middle of the Heian period, and since the medieval period, it became the hereditary post of clans of high reputation, the Sakagami clan and the Nakahara clan.

During the middle of the Heian Period, Myoho hakase tended to be a hereditary post for the Sanuki and Koremune clans, but from the medieval period, both clans were replaced and it became a hereditary post for the Sakagami and Nakahara clans of high reputation.
sen.cmt: Changed sentence order and fixed grammar to read more smoothly
sen.e: During the middle of the Heian period, Myoho hakase tended to be a hereditary post for the Sanuki and Koremune clans, but from the medieval period, both clans were replaced and it became a hereditary post for the Sakagami and Nakahara clans of high reputation.
sen.cmt: 表記を変えました。
